siteMetadata.title: /dev/null
siteMetadata.description: Personal blog, which mainly contains tutorial on how to perform specific development tasks

node.excerpt: Since with the release 11 some deprecated packages used by the Android SDK were removed, it's not yet possible to run it with the latest Java versions. As a workaround it's possible to download the required classes separately and add them to the classpath, or install the latest supported version, java 1.8. This latter approach is the recommended one.

frontmatter.title: Use Android SDK Manager with Java 11

node.excerpt:
Since with the release 11 some deprecated packages used by the Android SDK were removed, it's not yet possible to run it with the latest Java versions. As a workaround it's possible to download the required classes separately and add them to the classpath, or install the latest supported version, java 1.8. This latter approach is the recommended one.

Because of android SDK not correctly working with java 11, when run flutter doctor we'll get the following error:

$ flutter doctor
...
Android license status unknown.
Try re-installing or updating your Android SDK Manager.
...

To fix this, just follow the instructions to download the older version of Java.

frontmatter.title: Flutter: fix unknown android license stat

node.excerpt: There are different ways to add a comments section to your static website or blog, in this guide we won't talk about pros and cons of each solution but we will actually focus on how to use Disqus to enable users to leave comments on a blog generated with GatsbyJS.

frontmatter.title: Add Disqus comments to a GatsbyJS static blog

node.excerpt: This simple tutorial will show how is possible to call Go functions from a c/c++ code.

frontmatter.title: Use Go code in c/c++ applications

node.excerpt: Sometimes it happens that after installing different versions of Java you want to remove the old/unused ones: in this brief tutorial we'll see how to list all the installed versions and remove the one that are not required anymore from macOS.

frontmatter.title: Uninstall older versions of Java from macOS

node.excerpt:
As a developer you might have to deal with SSH keys to access specific API/machines, and a common approach is to have one key for everything. For security reasons it's good to use different ones so that if one of them is compromised the other services are safe and you don't need to revoke and regenerate the keys for all your API/machines.

In this guide I will show you how to use a different SSH keys for each domain.

frontmatter.title: How to use different SSH keys

node.excerpt: DataDog is a monitoring service for cloud-scale applications, in the following guide we'll see how to create a docker container with the DataDog agent and how to use it to publish custom metrics.

frontmatter.title: Install DataDog Agent as a docker container

node.excerpt:
In this guide I will show you how to use gRPC to write a simple client (in C++) and server (in Go) for your service.

For this tutorial we will use the code available in the following Github project:Â pasdam/grpcExample.

For the client, in this article I'll show how to write a command line one, but in the repository there is also a GUI client written with the Qt framework.

frontmatter.title: Use gRPC/protobuf with C++ and Go
